MIP 132.courseDesc: This course provides students with an overview of the music industry. The following topics will be addressed: major music industry players (e.g. managers, agents, business managers, promoters), record label operations & functions (e.g. recording deals, royalties, the album cycle), Songwriting/Publishing, Live Music/Touring, & Merchandising.
MIP 132.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 133.courseDesc: The objective of this course is to develop an understanding of the best practices of using a Digital Audio Workstation to create a music project. The class will be a combination of lecture modules and in-class hands-on practice.
MIP 133.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 161.courseDesc: This course is an in-depth exploration of what, how, when and where intellectual property exists in the music industry, with a particular emphasis on the role that copyrights play.
MIP 161.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 179.courseDesc: This course introduces the art of sound recording, including the fundamentals of sound, sound capture, acoustic environments, and recording technology.
MIP 179.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 212.courseDesc: This course explores the fundamentals of sound capture, audio signals, audio devices, sound systems, and signal interconnections.
MIP 212.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 227.courseDesc: Students will develop critical listening skills needed for all aspects of music production including commercial arranging, tracking, and mixing.
MIP 227.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 233.courseDesc: This course will help students develop proficiency in using Pro Tools for advanced music production and sound editing tasks. By engaging in hands-on exercises, lectures, and collaborative projects, students will acquire a comprehensive understanding of advanced recording, editing, and mixing techniques within the Pro Tools environment.
MIP 233.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 270.courseDesc: This course will cover the various business aspects of producing and promoting successful tours and concerts. The class will place emphases and cover in great detail: (1) the promoter’s ability to purchase talent and produce shows, taking into consideration such matters as competition, population, guarantees and percentage splits, ticket pricing and distribution, advertising budgets, production costs, sponsorships, rental agreements, labor, security, concessions, tour packages, and promoter-owned venues; and (2) managing and producing a tour, focusing on a tour theme and marketing plan, routing, itineraries, riders, offers, contracts, sub-contractors, show and tour personnel, merchandising, sponsorships, day-of-show and show settlements.
MIP 270.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 275.fullName: Marketing in the Music Industry I
MIP 275.courseDesc: This course aims to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the foundations of marketing and promotion in the music industry, including the essential concepts, strategies, and tactics used by artists and music professionals to create impactful campaigns.
MIP 275.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 276.courseDesc: Sound recording techniques are presented to provide Music Industry Business Concentration students with basic recording competency through practical application. Students are required to create several recordings through projects that require teamwork and self-analysis.
MIP 276.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 279.courseDesc: Basic sound recording procedures are presented with an emphasis on microphone techniques, signal-flow, and session workflow. Requires students to create several multitrack recordings, including editing and mixing.
MIP 279.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 280.courseDesc: This course is a general overview of record label operations including the different roles at labels, different types of labels, and how the role of labels have changed over time.
MIP 280.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 282.courseDesc: This course provides an overview of how radio and music streaming is used in record promotion and artist development and includes both theory and practical applications.
MIP 282.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 283.courseDesc: Community Recording is an enterprise designed to foster empowerment and self-expression through music. It brings members of the Mantua, Powelton, and Drexel communities together to create a sustainable creative collective that produces and releases music and shares knowledge and techniques.
MIP 283.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 293.courseDesc: This course analyzes various music recordings, including the genres of jazz, pop, R&B, and rock, from the modern recording era (1930’s to the present) and discusses the production techniques used to create them.
MIP 293.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 318.courseDesc: Students work in interdisciplinary groups with Design and Merchandising students to create a comprehensive merchandise extension program including product selection, production, distribution and promotion within the context of the artists' overall brand package.
MIP 318.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 331.courseDesc: This course will cover the various business aspects of producing and promoting a successful concert. The class will place emphases and cover in great detail: the promoter’s ability to purchase talent and a produce show, taking into consideration such matters as competition, population, guarantees and percentage splits, ticket pricing and distribution, advertising budgets, production costs, sponsorships, rental agreements, labor, security, concessions, tour packages, and promoter-owned venues; routing, itineraries, riders, offers, contracts, sub-contractors, show personnel, merchandising, sponsorships, day-of-show and show settlements.
MIP 331.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 333.courseDesc: This course will develop students' understanding of digital audio and MIDI production techniques using Ableton Live by integrating in-class demonstrations, lectures, and hands-on projects and activities. Through these methods, students will acquire a comprehensive understanding of Ableton Live's capabilities and develop practical skills using this software to create high-quality audio productions.
MIP 333.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 336.fullName: Contracts and Legal Issues in the Music Industry
MIP 336.courseDesc: This course explores contractual agreements and the legal issues affecting the music industry today, such as free speech in radio and music lyrics, rights of publicity for recording artists, fair use and piracy, as well as the various standard agreements in common use in the music and recording industries.
MIP 336.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MIP 336.prereqs: MIP 161 [Min Grade D] and BLAW 201 [Min Grade D]

MIP 338.courseDesc: Students present Extra Curricular recording projects to the instructor and fellow students for an in-class critique. The in-class critique will give the student direct feedback on their creative work and allow them to compare their work against the work of their peers. The production critiques will be moderated by the instructor and grades will be assessed based on in-class participation and presentations.
MIP 338.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MIP 338.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 1 times for 4 credits

MIP 341.courseDesc: This course builds on the fundamental relationships in the concert business, from the technical and artistic aspects of concert promotion learned in Live Music II and introduces music tour planning. Students will examine how to hire employees for tour, create budgets, negotiate contracts, promote a tour and the logistics of tour production, marketing and managing government regulations, that in the end, will maximize revenue over multiple shows. Additionally, students will examine the effects of touring over extended times vs single shows, for artists and their touring parties.
MIP 341.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MIP 341.prereqs: MIP 270 [Min Grade D] and MIP 331 [Min Grade D]

MIP 350.courseDesc: This course introduces concepts including what an A&R rep does, historically and today; artist development in the major label and independent markets; and A&R methods using industry data.
MIP 350.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 361.courseDesc: This course explores the fundamental responsibilities of a music publisher including reviewing, evaluating, marketing, licensing, monetizing, representing and protecting original music, as well as the rights of songwriters and related content creators. Students will discover how music publishing is a crucial element of support in a thriving music industry and will learn how music publishers build value for their creative clients.
MIP 361.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 365.courseDesc: This course is designed to give students an introductory insight and understanding of the music industry in the chosen location of the class. This class is a Study Tour.
MIP 365.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 366.courseDesc: Students will be introduced to the creative and administrative elements of music supervision including sourcing, evaluating, licensing, and placing music into visual productions.
MIP 366.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MIP 366.prereqs: MIP 161 [Min Grade D] or MIP 361 [Min Grade D]

MIP 374.courseDesc: Students will learn how to devise, conceive, create and implement a music industry-related business through the drafting of a business plan. This course is team-driven and will involve student discussions and critique.
MIP 374.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 375.fullName: Marketing in the Music Industry II
MIP 375.courseDesc: Building on the foundations of Marketing in the Music Industry I, this course provides students with an advanced and applied understanding of the strategies and tactics used to promote music and music-related content across different channels and through various forms of media. Students will utilize insights-driven reasoning, creative ideation, and critical thinking to solve marketing challenges, meet promotional objectives, and drive engagement with target audiences. This course is team-driven and involves extensive student discussions, critique, and group project work in and outside of the classroom.
MIP 375.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MIP 375.prereqs: MIP 132 [Min Grade D] and MIP 275 [Min Grade D]

MIP 376.courseDesc: MAD Dragon Music Group is designed to immerse students in the world of the independent music business and includes all of the professor led, student operated enterprises that create, organize and administer MAD Dragon Music Group projects.
MIP 376.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MIP 376.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 9 credits

MIP 379.courseDesc: An advanced examination of current state of the art sound recording techniques. Special attention is paid to concert recording, digital and analog mixing techniques, advanced compression and equalization techniques, and time-based processing. Research methods in sound are introduced.
MIP 379.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 381.courseDesc: This course will introduce the student to the technological and creative aspects of creating post-production audio for visual media.
MIP 381.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MIP 381.prereqs: MIP 233 [Min Grade D] and MIP 279 [Min Grade D]

MIP 382.courseDesc: This course will expand the students' ability to create and produce an original score for an audio/visual element, drawing upon their creative and technological skills.
MIP 382.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 384.courseDesc: The primary goal of this course is to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of synthesis and sampling techniques used in contemporary music production. Throughout the course, students will develop practical skills and knowledge related to various synthesis techniques, sound design, and the creative application of sampling, ultimately enabling them to produce innovative and high-quality audio elements for various musical genres and projects.
MIP 384.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 387.courseDesc: Introduces the student to basic maintenance and troubleshooting techniques used in the modern recording studio. Basic electronic components, cabling, soldering skills, audio measurements, and equipment calibration are emphasized.
MIP 387.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 388.courseDesc: Students will research the basic financial, business, marketing, and networking practices of successful freelancers in the music industry and explore career development strategies to thrive in the music industry gig economy.
MIP 388.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 389.courseDesc: This course covers all aspects of sound reinforcement for live performances, including system design, equipment usage, and acoustical concerns. The course uses both lecture and hands-on components for greater student understanding.
MIP 389.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 391.courseDesc: This class enables students to practice the art of analog recording, editing and mixing. It puts in perspective the concepts, tools, and techniques of studio production that can be taken for granted in the digital domain. The constraints and aesthetic choices that are magnified by the analog format are very important parts of a holistic music production curriculum.
MIP 391.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 393.courseDesc: This course is an examination of current state-of-the-art sound reinforcement techniques. Special attention is paid to system design and optimization, digital mixing console operation, wireless systems, and concert recording.
MIP 393.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 394.courseDesc: Through this course, students will gain a deep understanding of the role of data in the business of music, balancing theoretical concepts, illustrative case studies, and practical application.
MIP 394.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MIP 394.prereqs: MIP 132 [Min Grade D] and STAT 201 [Min Grade D]

MIP 395.fullName: Innovation in the Modern Music Industry
MIP 395.courseDesc: This course studies the profound evolution of the music industry by examining entrepreneurial and technological innovation in the post-Napster era. Through in-depth discussions, critical analysis, and collaborative projects, students will gain insight into the cultural, business, and creative transformations driving today’s music landscape, as well as their own potential to contribute to future industry innovation.
MIP 395.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 396.courseDesc: This course is designed to give students a global perspective of the recording business. Students will research individual markets and compare and contrast them in order to evaluate business conditions and consider future economic prospects.
MIP 396.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 418.courseDesc: This course will present advanced concepts and techniques utilized for creating post-production audio for video, television, and film. Students will also explore other current and future media, such as gaming and VR/XR/MR (virtual reality, extended reality, and mixed reality).
MIP 418.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 433.courseDesc: In this course, students will gain in-depth knowledge of advanced vocal and drum production techniques using Pro Tools, Ableton Live and Logic Pro. The course is structured around weekly studio sessions and hands-on learning experiences, covering a wide range of topics from vocal recording, and editing to drum replacement and multi-DAW production. Throughout the course, students will have the opportunity to work on various aspects of audio production, including vocal coaching, comping, tuning, alignment, repair, and mixing. Additionally, students will be introduced to multi-DAW production workflows and the process of creating multitrack and stems for mixing and mastering purposes.
MIP 433.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 467.courseDesc: This course examines the components that comprise an artist's professional team. The course will explore and analyze the central role that managers, attorneys, agents, business managers, services firms, record labels and other entities each play in representing, developing, and supervising the artist’s overall business and brand.
MIP 467.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 470.courseDesc: Students will be exposed to state-of-the-art research and industry experience from practitioners and researchers from the local and national stage. This course requires weekly participation in the department colloquium.
MIP 470.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MIP 470.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 4 credits

MIP 477.courseDesc: The students in this class learn contemporary music production techniques through a combination of lecture, demonstration and independent work.
MIP 477.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 481.courseDesc: This is an advanced audio engineering course that will focus on the technical and creative processes of mixing. Proper equipment usage, methods, formats, and production goals for various genres of music are covered.
MIP 481.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 483.courseDesc: This course explores the various technical processes involved in professional audio mastering, including dynamic range control, spectral balancing, distortion, and noise detection.
MIP 483.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 490.courseDesc: This course is a general overview of research methods used in the music industry. The course presents a conceptual basis for designing research and assessing research quality and illustrates these concepts through in-depth reviews of research areas, including (1) qualitative studies, (2) surveys and (3) experiments. The course also touches on basic descriptive statistics, inferential statistics and measures of association. This is a writing intensive course.
MIP 490.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

MIP 491.courseDesc: Senior Project is a thesis course in which student groups engage over two quarters of senior year in intensive research on a topic selected by a jury among individual proposals. The thesis will result in some form of publishable material.
MIP 491.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MIP 491.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 9 credits

MIP 495.courseDesc: Provides supervised individual study of special topics in the music industry. Departmental permission required.
MIP 495.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MIP 495.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MIP I199.fullName: Independent Study in Music Industry Program
MIP I199.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
MIP I199.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MIP I199.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MIP I299.fullName: Independent Study in Music Industry Program
MIP I299.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
MIP I299.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MIP I299.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MIP I399.fullName: Independent Study in Music Industry Program
MIP I399.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
MIP I399.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MIP I399.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MIP I499.fullName: Independent Study in Music Industry Program
MIP I499.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
MIP I499.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MIP I499.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MIP T180.fullName: Special Topics in Music Industry Program
MIP T180.courseDesc: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
MIP T180.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MIP T180.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MIP T280.fullName: Special Topics in Music Industry Program
MIP T280.courseDesc: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
MIP T280.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MIP T280.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MIP T380.fullName: Special Topics in Music Industry Program
MIP T380.courseDesc: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
MIP T380.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MIP T380.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

MIP T480.fullName: Special Topics in Music Industry Program
MIP T480.courseDesc: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
MIP T480.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
MIP T480.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
